person_189.name: WilliamWordsworth
person_189.description: English poet who, with Samuel Taylor Coleridge, published Lyrical Ballads. Davy contributed to seeing the second edition (1800) through the press in Bristol. Poet Laureate from 1843.

person_439.name: Jean SylvainBailly
person_439.description: French astronomer, mathematician, and political leader of the early part of the French Revolution.

person_130.name: Pierre-SimonLaplace
person_130.description: French mathematician seen as the Newton of France. He met Davy in 1813 and 1820. ForMemRSL.

person_266.name: Georges-Louis Leclerc, Comte deBuffon
person_266.description: French naturalist, mathematician and cosmologist. His Histoire Naturelle, published in 1789, ran to 37 volumes. ForMemRSL.

person_610.name: EtienneBonnot de Condillac
person_610.description: French Catholic priest and philosopher who studied psychology and philosophy of the mind.

person_508.name: Lucretius
person_508.description: Roman poet and philosopher. His only known work is the materialist philosophical poem De rerum natura.

person_300.name: DÃ©odat Gratet deDolomieu
person_300.description: French geologist. The rock, and region of the Alps, dolomite was named after him.

place_1095.name: Giza Pyramids
place_1095.description: In Egypt, the Giza pyramid complex is home to the Great Pyramid, the Pyramid of Khafre, and the Pyramid of Menkaure, along with their associated pyramid complexes and the Great Sphinx.

place_222.name: Africa
place_222.description: The world's second-largest and second-most populous continent.
